relation: Great for these types of students

Whittier College is great for students that like to be part of a small community and that enjoy smaller classrooms, which means that you get more individual attention. This school is perfect for students that are ready to leave the overcrowded classroom, which make one feel like just another student in the class.

Be prepared for the rigorous work, as you will no longer get by with the bare minimum. College - in general - asks more of students and this is preparing them for the workforce that will expect going above and beyond with your work. Attendance is crucial in college, as it not only affects your grade but your understanding of the course. Professors are no longer going to hold your hand and take you through all the steps, rather they will guide you to the correct path and let you choose if you want to take it. Most importantly, do not procrastinate because then you become overwhelmed when you glance at the piles of work that you have to do. It is best to do a bit of homework everyday because it ensures quality.

I feel that the education is worth the money that I am paying. Both the teachers and other faculty members provide a genuine service to the students. The faculty has the students' best interest in mind so they do not waste their time rambling about something that will not benefit the student. Plus the faculty and other members of the college are extremely helpful in all situations, whether it be going to the registrar's office or the business office.

Although I currently commute to the school, I find that the school has a wonderful atmosphere created by the diverse cultures that inhabit it. I enjoy being at Whittier College because it has a friendly environment that allows students to work with one another. Plus one feels encouraged to visit professors during their office hours as they are helpful and nice.

At Whittier College, there is not a day that I am not learning something new. It offers a wide variety of courses that will meet everyone's needs. I especially found the freshman writing seminar beneficial, as it helped me improve my writing. All the courses offer rigorous work that will keep one busy yet not feeling overwhelmed. This learning community allows one to learn not only from the teachers but the students as well.
